Each player works on forearm passes on their own with a volleyball each. This will allow for the maximum number of contacts in a short period of time.
Each player performs 30continuousforearm passes to themselves 30 times while not allowing the ball to touch the ground.
Repeat the contacts for 30 times. This time every pass should go about 5 feet above the player's head.
Repeat the contacts again for 30 times. This time, have the player make a 6 inch pass followed by a 5 foot pass and alternate between the each contact.
Repeat the contacts again for 30 times. This time, have the player spin 90 degrees after each pass.
Repeat the contacts again for 30 times. This time, have the player start in a low squat and touch the floor between each pass to themselves.
Make the players start over at 1 each time the ball hits the floor until they reach the set number of contacts.
Make sure each of the passes are performed with the forearms.
variations: You can increase or decrease the number of contacts based on the skill level of the players.

Roles: All players are passers/setters; the coach serves as the initiator.
The coach begins each rally by tossing a ball into play, alternating sides.
Players may only use the overhead pass (set) to keep the ball in play.
After completing an overhead pass, the player must sprint to the end line and return before rejoining the play.
Teams score using rally scoring, playing to 10 points.
Players can return the ball on the first, second, or third contact.
Require teams to return the ball only on the third contact to encourage better ball movement and communication.
Reduce team size to 4 players per side for more touches and conditioning.
variations: Add a time limit sprint (e.g., reach the end line and back in 5 seconds) to increase intensity.

Positioning: Feet shoulder-width apart, one slightly forward, knees bent, balanced on the balls of the feet.
Technique: Contact the ball at the forehead, using full-body extension (legs and arms) to guide the ball.
